resources

Class Fbo

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.Fbo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource

    public class Fbo
extends java.lang.Object
implements Resource
    Object oriented wrapper class above the native FBO. Supports 8 color attachments, the depth, the stencil and the depth24-stencil8 attachment. You can add textures or Render Buffer Objects as attachments.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fbo

        public Fbo(@NotNull
           org.joml.Vector2i size,
           boolean multisampled,
           int samples,
           boolean floatingPoint)
        Initializes a new FBO to the given value.
        Parameters:
        size - FBO's width and height
        multisampled - multisampled
        samples - number of samples, if the FBO isn't multisampled, it can be anything
        floatingPoint - FBO store color attachments as floating point values or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - width and height must be positive
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - samples can't be lower than 1

    • Method Detail

      • addAttachment

        @Bind
public boolean addAttachment(@NotNull
                                    Fbo.FboAttachmentSlot slot,
                                    @NotNull
                                    Fbo.FboAttachmentType type,
                                    int index)
        Adds the specified attachment to the FBO. If there is already an attachment in the given slot, this method don't do anything. If you want to add both depth and stencil attachments, you should add a depth-stencil attachment.
        Parameters:
        slot - attachment's slot
        type - attachment's type
        index - attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        Returns:
        true if the attachment added successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - slot and type can't be null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the slot is color attachment, the index must be in the (0;7) interval

      • isThereAttachment

        public boolean isThereAttachment(@NotNull
                                 Fbo.FboAttachmentSlot slot,
                                 int index)
        Return true if there is a texture or a RBO attachment in the given slot, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        slot - attachment's slot
        index - attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        Returns:
        true if there is a texture or a RBO attachment in the given slot, false otherwise

      • isThereAttachment

        public boolean isThereAttachment(@NotNull
                                 Fbo.FboAttachmentSlot slot,
                                 @NotNull
                                 Fbo.FboAttachmentType type,
                                 int index)
        Returns true if there is attachment in the given slot and it's type is the same as the given parameter.
        Parameters:
        slot - attachment's slot
        type - attachment's type
        index - attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        Returns:
        true if there is attachment in the given slot and it's type is the same as the given parameter, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - slot and type can't be null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the slot is color attachment, the index must be in the (0;7) interval

public Texture2D getTextureAttachment(@NotNull
                                                 Fbo.FboAttachmentSlot slot,
                                                 int index)

        Parameters:

        index - attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        Returns:
        the slot's texture attachment
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - slot can't be null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the slot is color attachment, the index must be in the (0;7) interval

      • isActiveRead

        public boolean isActiveRead(int index)

        index - attachment's index (0;7)
        Returns:
        true if the specified attachment is active to read, false otherwise
        Throws:

        public boolean isFloatingPoint()
        Determines whether the color attachments stored as floating point values.
        Returns:
        true if the color attachments stored as floating point values, false otherwise

      • isComplete

        @Bind
public boolean isComplete()
        Returns true if the FBO is complete, false otherwise. If it returns false it's not a problem by itself, but you can't use the FBO until it returns true. The getStatus method may help you identifying what's wrong with your FBO.
        Returns:
        true if the FBO is complete, false otherwise

      • getStatus

        @Bind
 @NotNull
public Fbo.FboCompleteness getStatus()
        Return the FBO's current status. It may help you to identify what is the problem with your FBO.
        Returns:
        the FBO's status

      • resolveFbo

        @NotNull
public Fbo resolveFbo()
        Resolves this FBO and all of it's attachments to another (not multisampled) FBO.
        Returns:
        resolved FBO

      • resolveFbo

        public void resolveFbo(@NotNull
                       Fbo toResolve,
                       @NotNull
                       Fbo.FboAttachmentSlot slot,
                       int fromIndex,
                       int toIndex)
        Resolves this FBO's specified attachments to the given FBO's specified attachment slot. If the slot is color, this method resolves this FBO's fromIndexth color attachment to the given FBO's toIndexth attachment slot. If the slot isn't color, this method resolves this FBO's attachment to the given FBO's same slot.
        Parameters:
        toResolve - destonation FBO
        slot - attachment's slot
        fromIndex - this FBO's attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        toIndex - given FBO's attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything

      • resolveFbo

        public void resolveFbo(@NotNull
                       Fbo toResolve,
                       @NotNull
                       Fbo.FboAttachmentSlot slot,
                       @NotNull
                       Fbo.FboAttachmentType fromType,
                       int fromIndex,
                       int toIndex)
        Resolves this FBO's specified attachments to the given FBO's specified attachment slot. If the slot is color, this method resolves this FBO's fromIndexth color attachment to the given FBO's toIndexth attachment slot. If the slot isn't color, this method resolves this FBO's attachment to the given FBO's same slot.
        Parameters:
        toResolve - destonation FBO
        slot - attachment's slot
        fromType - specifies the type of this FBO to resolve
        fromIndex - this FBO's attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        toIndex - given FBO's attachment's index (0;7), if slot isn't color attachment, it can be anything
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - slot can't be null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - both FBOs have to be usable, the same size and the specified attachment have to be exists

      • getSize

        @ReadOnly
 @NotNull
public org.joml.Vector2i getSize()
        Returns the FBO's width and height.
        Returns:
        the FBO's width and height

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the FBO and the FBO's attachments. After calling this method, you can't use the FBO and it's attachments for anything.
        Specified by:
        release in interface Resource

      • releaseFboRbo

        public void releaseFboRbo()
        Releases the FBO and it's RBOs, detaches the textures, but keeps alive the textures. You must have reference to all the FBO's textures, otherwise you cause memory leak. After calling this method, you can't use the FBO for anything.

public ResourceId getResourceId()

        Determines wheter this resource is usable. If it returns false, you can't use if for anything.

        Returns:
